Module jtrim.swing.property
Package org.jtrim2.property.swing

Class DelayedGlassPane

java.lang.Object
org.jtrim2.property.swing.DelayedGlassPane
public final class DelayedGlassPane extends Object
Defines the factories for glass panes where one glass pane is to be set immediately and the other is to replace it after the specified timeout, if the glass pane is still needed.

This class is used by the AutoDisplayState.glassPaneSwitcher methods to deter

Thread safety

Methods of this class are safe to be accessed from multiple threads concurrently. Not however that this is not true for the GlassPaneFactory instances.

Synchronization transparency

Methods of this class are synchronization transparent.
See Also:
  • AutoDisplayState.glassPaneSwitcher(javax.swing.JLayer, DelayedGlassPane)
  • AutoDisplayState.glassPaneSwitcher(javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, DelayedGlassPane)

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    long
    getGlassPanePatience(TimeUnit timeUnit)
    Returns the time to wait to use the panels created by the MainGlassPane instead of the ones created by the ImmediateGlassPane in the given time unit.
    GlassPaneFactory
    getImmediateGlassPane()
    Returns the glass pane factory whose panels are used to replace the glass pane of the decorated component immediately when the glass pane is to be applied to the associated component.
    GlassPaneFactory
    getMainGlassPane()
    Returns the glass pane factory whose panels are used to replace the glass pane of the decorated component after the given timeout elapses and if the glass pane is still needed to be applied to the associated component.

  • Constructor Details

    • DelayedGlassPane

      public DelayedGlassPane(GlassPaneFactory mainGlassPane, long glassPanePatience, TimeUnit timeUnit)
      Creates the DelayedGlassPane with the given panel factory and timeout to replace the panel applied immediately. Using this constructor will have an immediate glass pane which is invisible but blocks all user access to the decorated component.
      Parameters:
      mainGlassPane - the panel factory whose panels are used to replace the glass pane of the decorated component immediately when the glass pane is to be applied to the associated component. This argument cannot be null.
      glassPanePatience - the time in the given time unit to wait to use the panels created by the mainGlassPane instead of the invisible glass pane. This argument must be greater than or equal to zero.
      timeUnit - the time unit of the glassPanePatience argument. This argument cannot be null.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if any of the arguments is null

    • DelayedGlassPane

      public DelayedGlassPane(GlassPaneFactory immediateGlassPane, GlassPaneFactory mainGlassPane, long glassPanePatience, TimeUnit timeUnit)
      Creates the DelayedGlassPane with the given panel factories and timeout to replace the panel applied immediately.
      Parameters:
      immediateGlassPane - the panel factory whose panels are used to replace the glass pane of the decorated component immediately when the glass pane is to be applied to the associated component. This argument cannot be null.
      mainGlassPane - the panel factory whose panels are used to replace the glass pane of the decorated component after the given timeout elapses and if the glass pane is still needed to be applied to the associated component. This argument cannot be null.
      glassPanePatience - the time in the given time unit to wait to use the panels created by the mainGlassPane instead of the ones created by immediateGlassPane. This argument must be greater than or equal to zero.
      timeUnit - the time unit of the glassPanePatience argument. This argument cannot be null.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if any of the arguments is null

  • Method Details

    • getGlassPanePatience

      public long getGlassPanePatience(TimeUnit timeUnit)
      Returns the time to wait to use the panels created by the MainGlassPane instead of the ones created by the ImmediateGlassPane in the given time unit.
      Parameters:
      timeUnit - the time unit in which the the timeout value is to be returned. This argument cannot be null.
      Returns:
      the time to wait until using the MainGlassPane in the given time unit. This method always returns a value greater than or equal to zero.

    • getImmediateGlassPane

      public GlassPaneFactory getImmediateGlassPane()
      Returns the glass pane factory whose panels are used to replace the glass pane of the decorated component immediately when the glass pane is to be applied to the associated component.
      Returns:
      the glass pane factory whose panels are used to replace the glass pane of the decorated component immediately when the glass pane is to be applied to the associated component. This method never returns null.

    • getMainGlassPane

      public GlassPaneFactory getMainGlassPane()
      Returns the glass pane factory whose panels are used to replace the glass pane of the decorated component after the given timeout elapses and if the glass pane is still needed to be applied to the associated component.
      Returns:
      the glass pane factory whose panels are used to replace the glass pane of the decorated component after the given timeout elapses and if the glass pane is still needed to be applied to the associated component. This method never returns null.
